title: How to Make a No Bake Banana Pudding

steps.headline: In a large mixing bowl, stir pudding powder together with milk.
steps.description: Whisk for 2 minutes, then place in refrigerator for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: When the pudding has set, fold in one tub of whip topping and one can of sweetened condensed milk.
steps.description: You should now have a light, fluffy pudding mixture.

steps.headline: In a large serving bowl, place a layer of vanilla wafers, followed by a layer of sliced bananas.
Cover the cookies and bananas with a layer of pudding.
steps.description: Repeat this process, layering cookies, bananas, and pudding until all your pudding is used up.

steps.headline: Crumble vanilla wafers over the top of the pudding.
steps.description: Cover and refrigerate overnight to let the pudding soften the vanilla wafers.

text: In a large mixing bowl, stir pudding powder together with milk. Whisk for 2 minutes, then place in refrigerator for 5 minutes. When the pudding has set, fold in one tub of whip topping and one can of sweetened condensed milk. You should now have a light, fluffy pudding mixture. In a large serving bowl, place a layer of vanilla wafers, followed by a layer of sliced bananas.  Cover the cookies and bananas with a layer of pudding. Repeat this process, layering cookies, bananas, and pudding until all your pudding is used up. Crumble vanilla wafers over the top of the pudding. Cover and refrigerate overnight to let the pudding soften the vanilla wafers. Finished.
